education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.school: Khoury College of Computer Science, Northeastern University

about.description: I'm a Computer Science student at Northeastern University passionate about building innovative software solutions and exploring the intersection of AI, full-stack development, and human-computer interaction.
details: I have hands-on experience in full-stack development, machine learning, and Android development. I've interned at Teledyne FLIR working on multi-robot control systems and have participated in prestigious hackathons like HackMIT.

Beyond coding, I'm passionate about community building - I've organized hackathons, served as a student ambassador, and enjoy teaching programming to others. I'm always eager to tackle challenging problems and learn new technologies.

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern, Unmanned Ground Systems
experience.summary: Developed and maintained full-stack Android/Java software for multi-robot control systems.
description: Developed and maintained full-stack Android/Java software for the Multi-Robot Control System, enabling simultaneous control of multiple unmanned ground systems
Applied Agile best practices, unit testing (JUnit), and peer review to maintain code quality in a large, complex codebase
Implemented new features and proactively uncovered and resolved critical issues while optimizing Android lifecycle management and collaborating with cross-functional teams

experience.title: Executive Board Member
experience.summary: Organized the first student-led hackathon on the Northeastern Oakland campus.
description: Conceived and organized the first student-led hackathon on the Northeastern Oakland campus
Led funding team to successfully secure $15,000+ in sponsorships from Khoury College of Northeastern
Actively recruited 150+ students from universities across the U.S. to participate in the hackathon
Coordinated logistical support during the event, ensuring a positive experience for all attendees

experience.title: Student Ambassador
experience.summary: Awarded 1 of 25 worldwide Replit Student Ambassadorships.
description: Awarded 1 of 25 worldwide Replit Student Ambassadorships
Championed and grew the Replit community by hosting workshops, presentations, and meetups, teaching programming to 100+ students
Beta tested Ghostwriter AI to ensure smooth deployment and provided online support to Replit users

projects.name: Cosign - ASL Sign Recognition
projects.description: A CNN with LSTMs classifying 250+ motion-based isolated ASL signs. Selected to participate in HackMIT, placing top 15 out of 500+ participants in the MIT Hacks challenge. Utilized SocketIO for continuous webcam data streaming between Flask backend and React frontend.

projects.name: X Developer Challenge - Scam Detection Tool
projects.description: Led a team to create a machine learning tool that warns users of potential scam posts on their timeline. Selected to participate out of 1000+ applicants. Trained and integrated an LLM using few-shot learning for classification of tweets fetched via the X API.

projects.name: Tesla Sentiment Analysis
projects.description: Developed an NLP project to determine positive attributes people associate with Tesla. Utilized the VADER model in NLTK to analyze over 10,000 tweets and cleaned data using stopword removal and lemmatization.

projects.name: Mask Verified - COVID-19 Security
projects.description: Won 'Best Covid-19 Hack' by creating a program to enhance security during Covid-19. Trained a CNN using TensorFlow to detect mask usage based on facial landmarks via computer vision.
